candidates.title: Update webdriver requirement from 0.44 to 0.45

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on webdriver to permit the latest version. Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.title: Move to GitHub actions
candidates.body:
We now have good coverage across OSes, code coverage checking, better
lint checking, feature combination checking, and msrv/minimal-versions
checks.

candidates.title: Prepare 0.18.0 release
candidates.body: Given that [`cookie` 0.16.0 has been released](https://github.com/SergioBenitez/cookie-rs/releases/tag/0.16.0), we may make a 0.18.0 release now.

candidates.title: Disable the hyper http2 feature
candidates.body:
Since you're going to release a minor version anyway I wouldn't mind having the ability to reduce `hyper`'s dependencies.

---

Makes the `http2` feature optional and enables it by default.

candidates.title: Upgrade hyper-rustls to 0.23
candidates.body:
Properly updates to hyper-rustls 0.23, as #141 and #139 give errors when trying to compile with it.

Closes #141

candidates.title: Make webdriver a private dependency
candidates.body:
I've bumped crate version to `0.18.0`, as `webdriver` upgraded from `0.43` to `0.44`, so it's a breaking change.

Also, I've used `0.16.0-rc.1` for cookie as it uses `0.3` version of `time`. This doesn't count in public APIs, so transitioning to `0.16` should be non-breaking in future.

candidates.title: Add support for WebDriver cookie operations
candidates.body:
## Overview

This PR adds support for the cookie operations defined in [16. Cookies](https://www.w3.org/TR/webdriver1/#cookies) in the WebDriver spec. In particular, I've implemented the following operations:

* Get All Cookies
* Get Named Cookie
* Delete Cookie
* Delete All Cookies

The last operation, "Add Cookie", requires support from the `webdriver` crate.  The primary issue is that the `AddCookieParameters` struct does not implement `Serialize`, which means that we can't build the POST request on our side.  I'll be trying to get in touch with the geckodriver folks to see if this can be changed on their end.

## Changes

* Added a new module, `cookies.rs`.  This module contains the cookie-related `Client` methods as well as a few functions for converting between raw JSON (from WebDriver) and `cookie::Cookie` for the APIs.
* Added a simple integration testcase that triggers the `get_all_cookies` and `delete_all_cookies` operations.
* Removed the `binary` flag/arg when creating the WebDriver test client.  Both `chromedriver` and `geckodriver` are able to detect the path to the browser binary automatically on Windows and Linux.

Closes #59.

candidates.title: Lots of freshening up
candidates.body:
The PR adds many more links to the WebDriver specification, tidies up
the features a little, re-organizes the big `src/lib.rs` into smaller
files, and splits up `impl` blocks (and `fn` order) to correspond to the
command order in the spec.

candidates.title: Remove serial_test_derive dependency
candidates.body: `serial_test` since [0.3](https://github.com/palfrey/serial_test/releases/tag/v0.3.0) includes `serial_test_derive` and lets you use the macro without needing to directly include `serial_test_derive`

candidates.title: Bump webdriver and remove server feature
candidates.body:
`webdriver 0.43` made the server aspects of the code optional
(https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1684226). We take
advantage of that to get rid of `webdriver`'s `warp` dependency which
brought in an old version of tokio.

This change is unfortunately backwards-incompatible because we publicly
expose types from the `webdriver` crate.

candidates.title: Upgrade to tokio 1.0
candidates.body:
We still end up with an unused transitive dependency on tokio 0.2
through `webdriver`. Upstream has a pending fix for that in
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1684226, but this is still
worthwhile to get out the door.

Fixes #114.

candidates.title: Replace the test warp server with hyper (remove warp as a dependency)
candidates.body:
As suggested by @jonhoo in https://github.com/jonhoo/fantoccini/issues/114#issuecomment-755096495 to upgrade faster to tokio 1.0 we could remove warp as a dependency.
The warp server gets replaced by a very simple hyper service. As I don't see a reason why test files could be of another type than html, I've hard coded that in. But this could be fixed quite easily if at any point in time that assumption changes.
Or I can edit the pull request to be more "generic" over the file type, but that would probably require another dependency.

I would be happy to hear some feedback, this is my first pull request ever.

candidates.title: Move to rustls to stop linking to openssl
candidates.body: This is probably a personal preference in a way, but I have problems with other rust libraries and software that link to openssl and it can be hard to compile it on musl or without installing openssl libraries on the system so I think this will make it easier to deploy an application on alpine containers or on clean systems without openssl. This change switches hyper to a rustls connector and in my testing it passes all tests and compiles on musl.
